abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Tongbai Pumped Storage
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was negligible
            to low, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included:  The project confirmed that flexibility is
            paramount in dealing with a project that is being
            implemented while a major reform program is in progress.
            Commitment and support of government at various levels and
            strong ownership at the power utility level is a key to the
            success of the sector reform and technical assistance (TA)
            programs. Piloting has been a feature characteristic of
            Chinese reform and Bank-assisted power sector projects.
            Project elements explicitly designed to pilot new approaches
            include: competitive provincial power market, comprehensive
            Distribution Management System (DMS), condition-based
            maintenance, and leasing arrangement for a peaking
            generation plant. This approach, coupled with flexibility in
            the use of loan funding for low-cost high impact TA, could
            be a successful means to further reform and innovations.
            Delays in government clearance and approval process resulted
            in significant delays of project implementation. Effective
            re-scheduling and re-organizing project construction
            activities by experienced implementing agencies can often
            catch up delays during the project implementation and
            minimize the impacts. Cost estimates proved to be too high
            and resulted in excessive front-end fee and commitment
            charges to the Borrower. Significant cost savings were also
            achieved by a number of other Bank-assisted power
            project's in China. In-depth review of project design
            and unit prices could help reduce unnecessary financing costs.

5086953.trustfund: TF037062-CHINA - TONGBAI PUMPED STORAGE PROJECT,TF025701-PHRD-TONGBAI PUMPED STORAGE PROJECT
5086953.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Rural development

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Tongbai Pumped
            Storage Project, are to increase capacity, to further
            improve power load capability, and quality in the Zhejiang,
            and East China power systems, and, to improve the
            operational and investment efficiency in power generation,
            by implementing competitive generation markets in the
            Zhejiang Province. These objectives will be supported by the
            following components: 1) The development of the Tongbai
            pumped storage power plant, based on an existing upper
            reservoir, will consist of a new lower reservoir, impounded
            by a dam, with connecting tunnels, and an underground
            powerhouse. An environmental management plan will be
            implemented, as will a resettlement action plan to protect
            the affected population. In addition, the component includes
            consulting services, for engineering, design, procurement,
            and construction management assistance. 2) The transmission
            reinforcement comprises erection of twin transmission lines
            connecting the Tongbai plant to a 500 kv grid, and
            construction of substations. Existing substation lines will
            be expanded, and telecommunication equipment will be
            supplied, covering customer service centers. 3) A
            competitive program for power market development, and sector
            restructuring will be implemented.

441873.trustfund:
TF025722-PHRD-TECH.RENOVATION &

repnme.cdata!:
China - Tongbai Pumped Storage Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Tongbai Pumped Storage Project, which operates a pumping
            station and sub-stations to regulate peak energy demand,
            provide emergency service, and ensure the safe operation of
            the East China Power Grid. Possible negative impacts caused
            by project construction will be offset by the following
            countermeasures: The unstable slope caused by the large
            variation in the water level of the upper and lower
            reservoirs will be closely monitored. A flood releasing
            tunnel built will be set up and people alerted when the
            reservoir is being discharged. Project affected persons will
            be resettled locally and the land resources available per
            capita will be minimally changed. To offset negative impacts
            to the ecological environment in the resettlement host area,
            the area will be afforested and protected as a bamboo, tea,
            and fruit tree zone to attract tourists. A wastewater
            discharge plan will alleviate the impact of sewage discharge
            on water quality. Artificial watering will control quarry
            construction and road pavement dust. Vehicle washing in the
            area of the lower reservoir will avoid water pollution in
            the area of the upper reservoir. Waste oil will be burned or
            shipped away; and wastewater from mechanical equipment will
            be centrally treated before discharge. Sewage will be
            diverted to septic tanks, and the manure used as fertilizer,
            while dining hall sewage will be discharged through an
            oil-separation pool. Drinking water will be sterilized.

439211.trustfund:
TF025722-PHRD-TECH.RENOVATION &
            ENVIRON.REHAB.OF THERMAL POWER PLANTS,TF037062-CHINA - TONGBAI PUMPED STORAGE PROJECT,TF025701-PHRD-TONGBAI PUMPED STORAGE PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Tongbai Pumped Storage Project -
            resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
Resettlement of projected affected
            persons (PAPs) will follow these principles: The
            relationship between the state, the collective, and the
            individual shall be appropriately considered; The
            resettlement area and the host area shall be chosen in
            keeping with the national interest. The aim is to gradually
            raise the living standard of the resettlers. The
            resettlement will consider local conditions, and the
            resources of the reservoir area will be reasonably used.
            Resettlers will be settled in their original location or be
            moved nearby. Reclaiming the flood plain, reallocating land,
            and relocating populations will follow the relevant
            regulations and the rules of law. For land acquisition of
            medium and large water resources and hydropower projects, a
            land compensation fee and resettlement subsidy will be paid.
            The surplus labor created by land acquisition shall be
            organized by the local government to develop agriculture,
            sideline production, and village-owned enterprises. For
            those resettlers who voluntarily move to households of
            relatives or friends, subsidies for land acquisition and
            resettlement will be paid by the government of those moving
            to the host area government. Resettlers are not allowed to
            reject then relocation and will not be allowed to return at
            will after they resettle. There will be compensation for
            young crops and attachments with reduced compensation paid
            for uncultivated land. Compensation for trees will be tied
            to the actual value of output.

display_title.display_title:
China - Tongbai Pumped Storage
            Project - resettlement action plan (Vol. 2) : Transmission
            reinforcement component
